intro: Stifftia insignis, commonly known as the desert holly, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a small, shrub-like species that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant features small, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of white or yellow flowers during the spring. Stifftia insignis is well adapted to drought conditions, with deep roots and a slow growth rate. Its botanical characteristics make it a hardy and resilient species suitable for xeriscaping.
